attributes.action: Make ALL sanitary products, such as tampons & sanitary towels FREE for all women
attributes.additional_details: On avg. a girl will start her periods at 12 & the avg. woman will begin menopause at 51. The avg woman will have 468 periods in her lifetime; 468 times a woman will purchase sanitary products as well as pain relief. Stats from 2015 show that women spend on avg. £13 a month on sanitary products & £4.50 on pain relief. These numbers are outdated by 5 years, but based on them, the cost over a lifetime is just under £10,000. Women didn't ask for a period, it's biological so why should we pay?
attributes.background:
'Tampon tax' is being removed from tampons, however women should not have to pay for something they did not ask for. 
In 2019 the gender pay gap was 17.3% - women are paid less than men and then expected to pay for products that aren't a choice? 
We want ALL sanitary products to be free.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition instead:

The NHS should provide free sanitary products for anyone: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301619
